heading: 2.7 Share a repository
text:
possible share repository GitHub.Let‚Äôs say Kingsley repo GitHub wants collaborate Angelina project (Figure 2.3).

Regular pulling pushing important working files avoid merge conflicts.
merge conflict occurs two people modifying file time.
conflict can resolved, tedious best avoid.

chapter: 2 Version control with GitHub and RStudio
heading: 2.8 .gitignore file
text:
creating new GitHub repository can add .gitignore text file, tells git files ignored.
general, data output files committed, exceptions can useful relatively small unchanging files.Every change making file R project commit GitHub, tracked.
Commit files, code output GitHub, want track changes.
commit files, example output files like figures can easily recreated code.example .gitignore file:
code:
# History files
.Rhistory
.Rapp.history

# Session Data files
.RData

# RStudio files
.Rproj.user/

# OAuth2 token, see https://github.com/hadley/httr/releases/tag/v0.3
.httr-oauth
.Rproj.user

#data (excludes everything in the folder data)
data/*

# you can make exceptions for specific files
!data/dragon_taxonomy.csv

#figures & output (excludes all figure files)
*.png
*.pdf
*.jpeg

text:
Git foundSometimes, RStudio complain find git even install .RStudio click Tools > Global Options, select Git/SVN tab.Ensure path Git executable correct.
particularly important Windows may default correctly (e.g.¬†C:/Program Files (x86)/Git/bin/git.exe).Git workingIf use university windows computer, might default using path like\\helix\user_name\..UNC path.
Git work UNC paths.
Make sure start RStudio , example, O:\.Undo last commitIf committed something want , can undo last commit.
works pushed yet.
Go terminal type:help trouble shooting see https://github.com/k88hudson/git-flight-rules git.

heading: 3.1 What is a branch?
text:
branch lets develop code, fix problem, test idea without affecting original project.
branch created existing branch, usually main branch project.
Note main branch previously named master branch, removed reference slavery.
change might find references old name looking help elsewhere.can work branch, bravely develop code works work break code main branch.
Basically, can experiment .idea work another idea, branch can deleted nobody ever needs know .
Make new branch start .
None affect original project.working project, happy new code, idea tested working, can merge branch working main branch.

heading: 3.1.1 the workflow
text:
understand workflow, let‚Äôs see Kingsley using branches (see Figure 3.1).Kingsley owns GitHub repo.
clones repo computer (1).
develop code, create new branch (2) makes commits (3).
merges new branch main branch locally computer (4).
Finally, pushes changes remote repo GitHub (5).
Kingsley continue workflow (2-5).
Figure 3.1: Workflow using branches

Let‚Äôs look create, use delete branches.

now newly created branch.

want switch back main branch another branch, click box top corner switch.

heading: 3.1.5 Trouble shooting
text:
Check configurations TerminalYou might want check configurations repository.
Terminal can check origin repo, push pull.
show origin wrong.Go Terminal tab type repo type:

output look like :
Handle merge conflictA merge conflict can occur changing line one file differently, example using two different branches.goal avoid conflicts good strategy commit often, work small steps, push pull regular.
Merge conflicts can avoided use separate branches file creating editing.merge conflicts always avoided.
happen get notified Terminal trying merge new branch main branch.
message look like 
First, panic.
message simply tells merge merge ‚Äúdragon_analysis.R‚Äù file.Go file merge conflict, look like :
file merge conflict starts <<<<<< HEAD:dragon_analysis indicating name file.
two different versions code shown, separated ======.
Finally, >>>>>>> issue-5:dragon_analysis indicates end merge conflict.resolve conflict, edit section remove conflicting parts.
Basically, choose one versions combine .
Also remove conflict markers <<<<<<, ====== >>>>>>.
Save file, commit, switch main branch, merge push GitHub.Easy peasy!
code:
git remote -vorigin  git@github.com:kingsleyshacklebolt/magic_dragons.git (pull)
origin  git@github.com:kingsleyshacklebolt/magic_dragons.git (push)CONFLICT (content): Merge conflict in R/dragon_analysis.R### Dragon analysis ###

library("broom")

# Import data
source("R/import_dragon_data.R")


# Run model

<<<<<< HEAD:dragon_analysis 
mod <- lm(body_size ~ body_length, data = dragon)
======
  mod <- lm(body_size ~ body_length * temperature, data = dragon)
>>>>>>> issue-5:dragon_analysis 

tidy(mod)
### Dragon analysis ###

library("broom")

# Import data
source("R/import_dragon_data.R")


# Run model
mod <- lm(body_size ~ body_length * temperature, data = dragon)

tidy(mod)

heading: 4.1 What is a fork?
text:
GitHub useful developing code, point might want collaborate people project.
might come across GitHub repository want use starting point work.
cases forks way go.fork copy somebody‚Äôs GitHub repository.
can fork repo work independently original project.
collaborating people can stay connected original repository via pull requests.However, directly affect (damage) original project, somewhat less scary, right?

heading: 4.1.1 The workflow
text:
understand workflow, let‚Äôs see Angelina Kingsley collaborate using GitHub (see Figure 4.1).Kingsley owns GitHub repo.
Angelina forks repo (1) clones computer (2).
Angelina develops code using branches makes commits (3).
pushes changes remote repo GitHub (4) makes pull request original repo, Kingsley merges (5).now Angelina fetch (6) merge (7) newest changes upstream local repo continue workflow (3-5).
Figure 4.1: GitHub workflow using fork

change might find references old name looking help elsewhere.can work branch, bravely develop code works work break code main branch.

change main branch later update repo original repo, cause merge conflicts.

maintainer review pull-request maybe ask changes current branch.
maintainer satisfied, changes current branch merge main branch (see 2.10).Let‚Äôs look create, use delete branches.

type:Fetch downloads changes upstream.

heading: 4.2.7 Trouble shooting
text:
Check configurations TerminalYou might want check configurations repository.
Terminal can check origin repo, push pull.
forked repo also show upstream repo (see 4 Collaborating forks branches tutorial details).
also show origin wrong upstream repo set.Go Terminal tab type repo type:output look like :Handle merge conflictA merge conflict can occur two people changing line one file differently.goal avoid conflicts good strategy fo commit often, work small steps, push pull/fetch regular communicate people collaborating .
Merge conflicts can easily avoided work files.merge conflicts always avoided happen one pull request, get message resolve conflict changes can merge.
First, panic find files conflicting.conflicting file called dragon_analysis.
likely somebody changed file meantime recent version code.
Check status file upstream repo.
Fix changes, conflicting anymore, commit, push make pull request .
Now everything work.Prevent pushing mainWe already established collaborate repo using fork, never change main branch.
can difficult remember, way prevent committing main.
Install package usethis already.run code console:now trying commit changes main give warning message.
happens, make new branch, commit changes push.
code:
git remote -vorigin  git@github.com:angelinajohnson/magic_dragons.git (fetch)
origin  git@github.com:angelinajohnson/magic_dragons.git (push)
upstream        git@github.com:biostats-r/magic_dragons.git (fetch)
upstream        git@github.com:biostats-r/magic_dragons.git (push)install.packages("usethis")usethis::use_git_hook(
  hook = "pre-commit",
  script = '#!/bin/sh
  branch="$(git rev-parse --abbrev-ref HEAD)"
  if [ "$branch" = "main" ]; then
  echo "You cannot commit directly to main branch"
  exit 1
  fi'
)
